course.subject: COMP
course.name: Excel VBA Programming Bridging Course
course.description: This course introduces the VBA programming language, in the context of Microsoft Excel. It is intended for students who already have some experience in computer programming but wish to learn how to apply those programming skills to VBA, within Excel. The course covers basic programming topics, such as variables, functions and loops, to more advanced topics. Appropriate features of the Excel program are also covered. Students explore these by self-learning of course materials together with guided programming exercises. Students without the prerequisites but possess relevant programming knowledge may seek instructor's approval for enrolling in the course. Graded P or F.
course.prerequisites: COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022P OR ISOM 3320
course.exclusions: COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21), ISOM 3230

reviews.comment_teaching: The best teaching is no teaching at all. Unless you explicitly email the professor, he is nonexistent. He just marks your exercises and exams in the background and releases the marks as time passes. You are your own teacher; you control your own pace.
reviews.comment_grading:
>=240/400 marks from Exercises (each of the 4 exercises has a maximum of 100 marks) and >=40/100 marks from the Final Exam -> Pass

Revision Questions do not count towards the Pass. They have infinite tries and you can even just copy the expected answer and re-enter it during a retry because your source code is not one of the hard-coded answers.

You can even just do 3 exercises and still pass!
reviews.comment_workload: Just keep track of the deadlines and you will definitely be fine. Each "Lesson" is just a page of text; you can re-read however many times you want. Do it at your own pace.

reviews.author: EleJun
reviews.title: For interests
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly very basic stuff about using Excel (eg spreadsheet functions) and also basic programming stuff (eg loops, data types).
However even though it is basic, the syntax of VBA is quite different from other languages that we use normally.
But as the title suggests, I don't think many people would use VBA in daily situation, so probably recommend to people who are free and want to learn a new language just for interest.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is basically no teaching (needed), you just read the material on canvas by your self and do the homework every week. But if you have any questions go ask Gibson early (better long before deadline) and he replies quite quickly
reviews.comment_grading:
Just pass or fail, you need 70% from all for pieces of Homework and 40% from Final Exam.
The homeworks are fairly straightforward and easy, as long as u read the instructions and teaching material on canvas, you should get high if not full marks.
Final Exam is not too hard, but still you need to be familiar with the syntax of VBA, cannot blind guess/go into exam without revision

reviews.comment_teaching: Just like other COMP1029 bridging courses, there are no face-to-face lectures and all materials are offered online. The content is well structured and clearly delivered, so you should find no problem understanding the course content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail.

Need to get above 60% overall in the assignments (by finishing at least 3 out of 4 of them) and 40% in the final exam. These should be a piece of cake as soon as you pay attention to the deadlines and revise for the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 assignments and a final exam. Skeleton codes are provided in the assignments and we need to change / fill in a few lines of code. The assignments are slightly challenging, but should be handlable.

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.title: High workload for 1 credit course?
reviews.comment_content: This course is intended for students who already know one programming language. For example, perhaps you have already taken one of the introductory computer courses, such as COMP1021 Introduction to Computer Science (which teaches Python), or COMP1022P Introduction to Computing with Java (which teaches Java). If you have taken one of those courses, or any other programming course, then you can take this transition course to learn how to program the VBA language inside the Microsoft Excel program.

reviews.title: Don't be fooled by ustspace. VBA is a programming language which is quite different from other languages
reviews.comment_content: There are lots of contents on Canvas which you are able to learn by yourself. I strongly recommend you to learn them seriously and carefully, especially for the first two parts of the contents, as a good understanding of those basic contents is essential for you to be succeed in the exam
reviews.comment_teaching: As a self-study course, there is no teaching in the course at all.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F
You need to get 240/400 in exercise and 40/100 in exam to pass the course.
My scores: exercise1: 100/100 exercise2: 100/100 exercise3:70/100 exercise4: 100/100
Even though I get good scores in exercise, the exam in this year is extremely difficult. There are 20 exercises in total in the paper, with lots of small blanks. It's extremely difficult for you to finish them within one hour. Therefore, you should get good scores in the straight forward questions or you will possibly fail the course.
I didn't learn those basic knowledge about VBA well, so I got great panic during the exam .Even though I got A in COMP1021, due to the great panic, I almost finished nothing about the logic-required part of the exam. And due to my weak master of the basic knowledge, I almost fail the course.
My advice is: don't be fooled by ustspace, you need to learn that seriously or you will fail!!
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. It's easy to finish the required exercise. However, if you want to truly master VBA, you do really need lots of effort.
